benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Remove tags from invoice item

covered: DELETE - Valid Deletion: Success paths returning 204 are covered for removing all tags and for specific tagDef subsets; idempotent-like behavior when the item has no tags; ignores unexpected query params (TC01, TC02, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07).
DELETE - Non-Existent Resource: 404 when invoice item does not exist (TC08).
DELETE - Concurrency: High-concurrency scenario included to detect race conditions/perf issues (TC17).

Input validation: invoiceItemId UUID format -> 400 (TC09); tagDef variations—absent, empty, subset, not-on-item, malformed, very large, partially specified -> appropriate 204/400 handling (TC01–TC06, TC13, TC14, TC16).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present/missing (success and 400) and optional X-Killbill-Reason/X-Killbill-Comment handled (TC03, TC10, TC18).
Security/auth: 401 for invalid/expired token (TC11); injection/XSS attempts in headers rejected with 400/422 (TC15).
Reliability/integration: Service unavailable 503 is handled (TC12); dependent audit logging outage behavior covered (TC19).
Response semantics: 204 with empty body asserted for successful operations across scenarios.
gaps: DELETE - Soft Deletes: No test clarifies whether removal is hard vs soft delete or how reversibility/audit is expected.
Authorization/Permissions: No 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user lacking rights to remove tags.

Collection format semantics: tagDef is defined as collectionFormat=multi. No explicit tests for repeated query params (?tagDef=id1&tagDef=id2), handling of comma-separated lists, whitespace/URL-encoded values, or duplicate IDs.
Non-existent tag definition IDs: No scenario where tagDef contains valid UUIDs that do not map to any tag definition in the system (distinct from tags not present on the item).
Mixed validity in tagDef: No test where some tagDef entries are valid and others malformed/non-existent to assert all-or-nothing vs partial processing behavior and returned status.
Response headers: 'Produces: application/json' not validated on error responses (Content-Type); and no assertion that 204 responses omit Content-Type/Content-Length>0.
Explicit idempotency: No test sending the same DELETE twice on the same item to confirm the second call returns 204 and has no side effects.
Rate limiting/throttling: No coverage for 429 Too Many Requests or similar policies under burst traffic.
Server error handling: No simulated 500 (e.g., database failure) to validate error schema and resiliency.
Ambiguity: TC14 expects 204 or 413 depending on limits—nondeterministic assertion weakens test value; expected outcome should be defined.
Data isolation: No explicit check that removing tags from one invoice item does not affect tags on other items.
Observability/audit: No verification that audit entries are written on success with CreatedBy/Reason/Comment captured.
recommendations: Add a soft-delete/behavior clarification test (or mark as not applicable) and verify persistent state/audit expectations accordingly.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user lacking permission to remove tags.
Test tagDef collectionFormat=multi explicitly: repeated tagDef params, handling of comma-separated values (accept or reject), duplicate IDs, whitespace/URL-encoded UUIDs.
Add a scenario where tagDef contains valid-but-nonexistent tag definition IDs; define expected status (likely 400) and message.
Add a mixed-validity scenario (some valid, some malformed/nonexistent) to confirm all-or-nothing vs partial processing and returned status code.
Assert response headers: for errors, Content-Type: application/json with a well-formed error payload; for 204, ensure empty body and no inappropriate Content-Type.
Add an explicit idempotency test: issue the same DELETE twice; both should return 204 and leave state unchanged on the second call.
Introduce rate limiting/throttling test to validate 429 behavior (if applicable).
Simulate internal failures (e.g., DB outage) to verify 500 handling and error schema consistency.
Make TC14 deterministic: define a concrete maximum number of tagDef values and assert 413 with a specific error payload when exceeded; otherwise assert 204 when within limits.
Add a data isolation test to ensure operations affect only the targeted invoice item.
Verify audit trail creation on success by querying audit logs to confirm CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded.
